fees.description: Retailers administration fee for a dishonoured cheque payment (maximum).
Fee for historical billing data more than two years old.
Manual Read Fee for Type 4A Meter.
Fees for customer-initiated services (ACS) delivered by your distributor. Charged on a cost pass-through basis. Fees vary and are generally set by the AER
Financial institution fee for a dishonoured payment - no more than the fee incurred by the retailer.

electricityContract.terms: Full terms and conditions will be provided in your welcome kit when you become a customer. Alternatively, they can be accessed at  www.ergon.com.au/contracts
electricityContract.variation: Prices are reviewed every 12 months by the regulator and implemented 1 July annually. We will publish details of any price variation on our website.

demandCharges.description: Peak Monthly Demand Charge - This is a residential time-of-use monthly demand primary tariff.   Peak chargeable demand in any month is the maximum demand recorded between 4:00pm to 9:00pm on any day during that month and is charged on a kilowatt basis. The kW/day rate is multiplied by the number of days in the billing month, and then multiplied by the maximum demand.
demandCharges.displayName: Peak Monthly Demand Charge ($ per kW per month).

timeOfUseRates.description: For electricity usage between the hours of 4.00 pm and 9.00 pm.
For electricity usage between the hours of 9.00 pm and 11.00 am.
For electricity usage between the hours of 11.00 am and 4.00 pm.

singleRate.description: Supply will be available for a minimum of 8 hours per day, but may be reduced in an emergency. Times when supply is available is subject to variation at the absolute discretion of the distributor.

greenPowerCharges.description: For $10 per quarter, we ensure 650kWh of electricity will be fed into the grid from accredited GreenPower sources. This is enough to power 10% of the average Queensland home.
For $25 per quarter, we ensure 1625kWh of electricity will be fed into the grid from accredited GreenPower sources. This is enough to power 25% of the average Queensland home.
For $50 per quarter, we ensure 3250kWh of electricity will be fed into the grid from accredited GreenPower sources. This is enough to power 50% of the average Queensland home.
For $75 per quarter, we ensure 4875kWh of electricity will be fed into the grid from accredited GreenPower sources. This is enough to power 75% of the average Queensland home.
For $100 per quarter, we ensure 6500kWh of electricity will be fed into the grid from accredited GreenPower sources. This is enough to power 100% of the average Queensland home.

solarFeedInTariff.description: Solar flat feed-in tariff for regional Queensland. This amount is not subject to GST.

electricityContract.onExpiryDescription: Starts when you begin receiving retail services related to the provision of electricity to your premises. Concludes when you notify us to stop providing customer retail services.
electricityContract.additionalFeeInformation: Fees may apply for additional services. Please see the fees and charges schedule at www.ergon.com.au for further details.
